summary: This bill, the Protecting Individuals with Down Syndrome Act, aims to amend Title 18 of the United States Code to prohibit abortions performed because the unborn child has been diagnosed with Down syndrome. It defines abortion, Down syndrome, and qualified plaintiffs, and outlines criminal penalties, civil remedies, and reporting requirements. The bill emphasizes the value and dignity of individuals with Down syndrome and seeks to prevent discrimination against them in the context of abortion.
